bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Laura Reed Blincoe, November 14, 1893

div1.p: Reed briefly describes his new responsibilities at the Columbian University Medical School and the Army Medical Museum. He also relates family news. [Courtesy of the Library of Virginia]

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Laura Reed Blincoe, November 14, 1893

opener.dateline:
Army Medical Museum,
Washington, D.C.
Novr 14, 1893

div1.p:
Your
darling letter & postal both
reached me, and I am
ashamed to say that I
have been so very busy
with my duties in the
School that I have neg-
lected to write to anyone.
Have been in Washington
Since Septr 5th - My duties
are new to me and hence
my work is just 20 times
times as hard as it ought
to be. Next session, it will
be plainer sailing - As
Secretary of the Faculty - and
as Curator of the Museum,
I am summoned away
from my proper work
in the School 20 times every
day - I never was quite
so busy - Get to my office
at 9 a.m. & stay till 5,30 p.m.
On the jump all the time,
but sleep well at night.
Next day, go at it again.
Christmas will bring one
week's respite, when
I hope to run down to
Farmville for 2 days,
& perhaps, spend one day
with you. Can't make any
promises - We are not
keeping house - will prob-
ably board till next fall -
Living here awfully expen-
sive. Emily & children well.
Lawrence goes to High
School and Baby to Franklin
School - Both studying
well & both sweet chil-
dren - So glad that Sallie
is happy at Uncle Kit's.
E. & children join me in
much love - Kiss the children.
write soon,
